panel.title: ILS Automation Installer for UPDATING EMC Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: Welcome to the ILS Automation installer for UPDATING EMC Ignition Applications. The table below compares the existing installation of this product on this system, if any, with the versions contained in this new installation. Before continuing, please make sure that you have defined tag providers and database connections for both production and isolation-mode (test) environments as appropriate. Before proceeding please make a gateway backup and a database backup!

panel.title: End User License Agreement (EULA)
panel.preamble: Click on the button below to view the license that specifies permissible use of the software to be installed. Select the checkbox to indicate acceptance of the terms. You must accept the license terms before proceeding.

panel.title: Common interface Definitions
panel.preamble: Specify tag provider and database connections as used by various Ignition Applications. Both production and test mode versions of provider and database must be specified. The selections here are used by subsequent screens.

panel.title: Custom Icons for Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: Custom icons are used extensively when drawing blocks in the Block Language Toolkit. They are also used on many of the user windows.

panel.title: Python Code for Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: This page loads Python code that supports the Ignition Application suite. The Python is code developed by ILS Automation that is generic and used throughout the toolkits. The Java jar files that are referenced by the Python. The installer DOES NOT overwrite site specific Python in the XOM Python tree.

artifact.name: Jar Files to Support External Python

panel.title: Install Custom BLT Module
panel.preamble: This step installs the latest BLT module.

panel.title: Install Custom SFC Module
panel.preamble: This step installs the latest ILS-SFC module.

panel.title: Product Documentation
panel.preamble: The list below contains both user-level and design documents. They may be downloaded individually,as needed.

panel.title: Test Framework Module
panel.preamble: This step installs the test framework module. The test framework is optional and should not be used on a production system. When used on a hybrid Production / Development system then great caution must be used to insure that test data does not leak to the production system.

panel.title: Installation Summary
panel.preamble: The list below shows which of the installation steps have been completed. Selecting "Finish" will record the current version of EMC Ignition Applications in the Gateway internal database.

epilog.title: Ignition Applications - Installed
epilog.preamble: Now that all of the automated installation and configuration of the ExxonMobil Ignition Applications is complete, there are just a few more manual steps required.
epilog.note: If this is the first time that a particular module has been installed, then it will be in a quarantined state at the end of the installation. Navigate to the "Module" screen on the Gateway page. Select the "install" option next to the listing of each quarantined module.
Several modules with active components have been installed. A Gateway restart is required.
Newly created projects are disabled when they are installed. They must be enabled before use. Edit each project setting it to "enabled" and then restart the Gateway.
The core project resources need to be manually merged using the Ignition Designer. Load your main XOM project and then merge the xom.proj found in user-lib/projects.
